title: Dries Mertens admits he wants to extend Napoli deal
text:
Dries Mertens has expressed a desire to extend his contract at Napoli

Dries Mertens has put the ball in Napoli's court after declaring that he would like to stay beyond this summer.

The 32-year-old has established himself as a Napoli icon over the past six years and is just one goal away from Diego Maradona's record of 115 goals for the club.

The Belgian forward remains a key figure in Carlo Ancelotti's side and has netted five times in eight games so far this season.

Dries Mertens wants to stay at Napoli and has ruled out a move to Asia if he is released

His contract expires in the summer and Mertens has informed the club he is keen to stay, though a decision on his future is yet to be taken.

He told RBTF: 'I've never felt so fresh. I'm 32, but I feel better than some 25, 26 year-olds. Maybe it's because I don't have kids. I'm playing the best football of my career and I intend to play well for a long time.

'Of course I think about Maradona's record. Everyone's talking about it! I'm very proud about getting so close to a legend like Diego.

'I can only say that I want to stay at Napoli, but right now I can't say any more than that.'

Mertens has scored five goals this season and is one away from Deigo Maradona's record

Mertens has insisted he will not be drawn out to Asia by big money should he become a free agent in the summer and wishes to remain playing in Europe.

However, he admitted it would be unlikely he would join another Serie A side, putting Premier League, La Liga and Bundesliga clubs on red alert.

He added: 'If I leave Napoli, I'll miss everything. I certainly don't see myself signing for another Italian club. It would make me feel strange because I feel at home in Naples.

'I also don't see myself signing for a club in China or Qatar: like I said, I hope to play for as long as possible in Europe at the highest level. I don't think I'll finish my career in Belgium.'
description: Dries Mertens has put the ball in Napoli's court after declaring that he would like to stay beyond this summer. The Serie A giants are yet to open contract talks with the forward.
